result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent R Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs/surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances/drugs or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Anger management and counseling to be determined by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court denies expunction request.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Brent R Weber in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #3.  Read in list filed.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #3. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substancesdrugs or drug paraphernalia;
Anger management and counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
FINE or COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Court denies expunction request
